description: Digital payments have surged in popularity in India, particularly through methods such as the Unified Payments Interface (UPI). However, with this rise in digital transactions comes an increased risk of financial fraud. To tackle this issue, biometrics is increasingly being adopted as a mainstream security measure for digital payments in the country. Airtel is among the latest examples, introducing a face biometrics system to safeguard customer accounts from fraudulent activities. title: Biometrics feature launched by Airtel as India steps up KYC
